name: Malmaison Manchester

reviews.title: Malmaison perfectly located

reviews.title: Funky & Gorgeous, a delight to stay here...

reviews.title: Ok, but too expensive
Diabolical
reviews.text: Overall, I thought the hotel offered value for money although I would say avoid the Malmaison bistro as it's overpriced and there are far better restaurants within walking distance.

reviews.title: Absolutely appalling/unhelpful/rude!!!!!!
reviews.text: Breakfast is also not worth the £18 price tag!
Don't quite know where to start with this hotel as everything about it was perfect with a capital "P".
reviews.title: Manchester's hidden jewel

reviews.text: I think firstly "Jamie" the duty manager should be mentioned as he changed our anniversary from what started out as a disaster into a very very memorable special occasion. We had the "Moulin Rouge suite" at Malmaison only for one night but memories to last for ever!!!!!!!! He'd arranged champagne on ice(and it was decent champagne too!)strawberries dipped in chocolate,fruit,and mineral waters which were all complimentary all arranged in our room. We had a spectacular 4ft deep bath with lots of freebie toiletries in our room and dressing gown and slippers were also provided. The restaurant food was very fancy but very delicious and we enjoyed a lovely evening meal and a tasty breakfast the followingmorning.As we checked out we were also given a bag of "Malmaison" toiletries as a christmas present.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Staff very friendly, room very nice and comfortable, great location

reviews.text: So we would like to thank everyone at the hotel for such a wonderful and special stay, but a special thankyou to "Jamie" for everything and for giving us the opportunity to sample the "Malmaison experience. We will definitely stay here again and will recommend you to everyone we know.
reviews.title: Stylish and cool

reviews.text: Merry christmas and a Happy New Year

reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: Arrived early at this hotel (9am) reception staff let us put our cases in the room so that we could spend the whole day shopping!. Got in the room about 2pm and we were so chuffed with it. Lovely and spacious. Beds were so comfortable it was difficult to get out of them.We had a view of a canal, was bit annoyed that we were not informed there is building work going on nearby so got woken up by cranes and drills making loud noises. Rooms had hairdryer, mini-bar, 2 telephones, internet point. Gorgeus bathroom with a power shower and fluffy towels!. We flew to manchester so got the train from the airport to manchester picadilly and the hotel is about a 5min walk from the station if that. From this hotel we walked to picadilly gardens and the Arndale centre. 1 thing i would say about the hotel is that we asked reception to book us a cab from the hotel to a restaurant it cost us £6 yet on return we hailed a cab from just outside the restaurant and it only cost us £3 to get back to the hotel. Didnt have breakfast at the hotel but prices were around £13.
reviews.title: Lovely central hotel and i cant wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid the standard £160 per room. The room was ok, nothing different to all the other "trendy boutique-style" hotels up and down the country. The restaurant was ridiculously expensive - £11 for a burger and some McDonalds style chips! I thought the cooked breakfast was very good indeed although again very expensive. However my biggest gripe (as other reviewers have also noticed) is the staff. At a trendy hotel such as this, you expect young staff who are not only cheery but helpful and friendly. The Mal staff are none of these things. I found them moody, unhelpful and totally disinterested in their customers, just checking people in and out on a rote without any personality. It's a shame, management needs to do something about this, because this hotel has the potential to be great (and at those charges it certainly thinks it is) but, as with many things in this life, it is the human touch that lets it down.
reviews.title: A bit overpriced for what it is

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on on the 16th September and what can i say. It was a weekend away and we flew from Norwich early. So surpised when we checked in and given our room at 9.00am. Room its self clean and modern, staff never once stopped smiling our entire stay. The bar its self has a lovely choice of champagne, yes it pricy, but its the centre of Manchester!!!.
reviews.title: You wont find better

description: Mal Manchester: In the home of the beautiful game you're about to turn Moulin Rouge. A short trundle for wheel-based luggage from Piccadilly Station and you're at the Mal - somewhere in the mists between Paris and the 24-hour party city. You cross the chessboard reception and suddenly you're a king for the knight. It's your move. Smoak Bar and Grill at Mal Manchester: A grill room and bar quite unlike anything Manchester has ever before seen. Set in the award-winning Malmaison Hotel minutes from Piccadilly station, Smoak is total indulgence for the senses. The amazing aroma of nation's finest oak-smoked steaks and fresh fish, served to a pewter counter or cosy booth. Imagine great imported beers, cocktails and bubbly served from an unusual sunken bar, with highly skilled mixologists serving you while you stay seated. Picture a stylish relaxed but chic interior a mix of booths, banquettes and counter stools. Come lunchtime and it's locally sourced bread, generously filled sandwiches and salads or full blown grill dining for the more adventurous lunchtime escapee. Come sundown the mood changes and we turn the aromas up to eleven. The cocktails flow, the steaks sizzle, the music turns up and the night begins. Ember Lounge at Mal Manchester: We could tell you about the Ember Lounge - an immaculate and opulent cocktail bar furtively hidden to the rear of the Smoak Bar & Grill.
